data.title: Top 100 Science Fiction Movies
data.meta_description:
Best Science Fiction movies of All Time  Best movies with Science Fiction plot in any form (post-apocalyptic, dystopian fiction, monsters films, super-hero films, time travel, disaster movies, fantasy e.t.c.).

Definition: Science fiction film is a genre that uses speculative, fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream science, such as extraterrestrial lifeforms, alien worlds, extrasensory perception and time travel, along with futuristic elements such as spacecraft, robots, cyborgs, interstellar travel or other technologies. Science fiction films have often been used to focus on political or social issues, and to explore philosophical issues like the human condition. 

Essential / Must-see / Genre-defying: Science Fiction movies: 
* 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)
* Star Wars (1977)
* Alien (1979)
* E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial (1982)
* Blade Runner (1982)


Other Lists: Top 100 Fantasy Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls088139065) Top 75 Fresh-Take Science Fiction Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls522348095) Top 75 Science Fiction Horror Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls545078000) Top 75 Superhero Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls540698213) Top 75 Disaster Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls527348838)
data.text:
Best Science Fiction movies of All Time

Best movies with Science Fiction plot in any form (post-apocalyptic, dystopian fiction, monsters films, super-hero films, time travel, disaster movies, fantasy e.t.c.).

Definition: Science fiction film is a genre that uses speculative, fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream science, such as extraterrestrial lifeforms, alien worlds, extrasensory perception and time travel, along with futuristic elements such as spacecraft, robots, cyborgs, interstellar travel or other technologies. Science fiction films have often been used to focus on political or social issues, and to explore philosophical issues like the human condition.

Essential / Must-see / Genre-defying: Science Fiction movies:

2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)

Star Wars (1977)

Alien (1979)

E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial (1982)

Blade Runner (1982)
